title: U.S. will speed transfer of Abrams tanks to Ukraine, Pentagon says
description: The new plan calls for refurbishing tank hulls already in the U.S. arsenal rather than procuring new vehicles, which had been expected to take up to two years.

title: US 'concerned' by Mexican seizure of Alabama company's port
description: The U.S. State Department says it is “concerned about the fair treatment of our companies in Mexico” after Mexican police seized a cargo terminal owned by an Alabama-based company

title: Decline in number of monarch butterflies wintering in Mexico
description: The number of monarch butterflies wintering in the mountains of central Mexico dropped by 22%, and the number of trees lost in their favored wintering ground more than tripled compared to last year

title: Tanzanian officials confirm 5 dead from Marburg disease
description: Tanzania’s health ministry has confirmed that five people have died and three others are being treated for the Ebola-like Marburg disease

title: Ecuador officials have suspect in explosives sent to media
description: Authorities in Ecuador are investigating small explosives sent to journalists at several media outlets, one of which detonated but did not injure anyone

title: Fireworks explosion leaves 7 dead, 15 injured in Mexico
description: A powerful blast at an illegal fireworks workshop near Mexico City has left seven people dead and 15 injured

title: Uganda's legislature passes harsh new anti-LGBTQ bill
description: Ugandan lawmakers passed a bill prescribing jail terms of up to 10 years for offenses related to same-sex relations, responding to popular sentiment but piling more pressure on the East African country’s LGBTQ community

title: Xi’s cocoon in Moscow: A Chinese-owned hotel over Red Square opulence
description: Sino-Russian relations have grown substantially closer since Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and the West’s imposition of punishing sanctions.

title: Xi and Putin showcase their alliance but offer no path to peace in Ukraine
description: On the second day of a state visit, the leaders-for-life emphasized economic ties, which have grown far stronger between their countries since Russia's invasion of Ukraine

title: Strong earthquake rattles Pakistan, residents flee homes
description: A strong earthquake has rattled Pakistan’s capital Islamabad and other parts of the country, sending panicked residents fleeing from their homes

title: Pakistani intelligence officer, driver killed, officials say
description: Officials say suspected militants ambushed a vehicle carrying a senior military intelligence officer in northwest Pakistan, killing him and his driver

title: Missing porcupine Brain returns to zoo, Pinky still missing
description: Police say one of two porcupines which went missing from a zoo in central Germany over the weekend has somehow found its way back home

title: UN: Fresh gang violence in Haiti leaves 187 dead in 11 days
description: The U.N. says that new clashes between gangs in Haiti’s capital and beyond have killed at least 187 people in less than two weeks and injured more than 150 others

title: Boris Johnson lays out his Partygate defense ahead of Parliament grilling
description: The former prime minister plans to tell Parliament Wednesday that he told the truth about the lockdown parties according to what "he believed at the time."

title: Killing of Kurds in northern Syria sparks protests, tensions
description: Thousands of Kurds have taken to the streets of the earthquake-ravaged Syrian town of Jinderis

title: UK police: Suspect arrested after man set alight near mosque
description: Detectives in England are investigating an attack in which a man was set alight as he walked home from a mosque

title: Another art museum chief quits as Russia pressures cultural institutions
description: As war rages in Ukraine, museum officials in Russia are being told that their exhibitions must reflect the nation's spiritual and moral values.

title: Belgian police fatally shoot patient at psychiatric clinic
description: Officials say a patient carrying a bladed weapon has been fatally shot by Belgian police at a psychiatric clinic in Brussels

title: U.K. scientists plead for return of rare shark’s head, promise ‘no judging’
description: The smalltooth sand tiger shark was called a “once-in-a-lifetime find in British waters” — but the head and tail were chopped off before scientists could see them.

title: Protests in Lebanon as pound hits new low against dollar
description: Protesters have closed down major roads in parts of Lebanon after the Lebanese pound briefly hit a new low amid a historic economic crisis that seemingly has no end in sight

title: 'Winnie the Pooh' film pulled from Hong Kong cinemas
description: Public screenings in Hong Kong of a slasher film that features Winnie the Pooh have been scrapped, sparking discussions over increasing censorship in the city

title: UN chief's call for ambition on climate gets muted response
description: Senior government officials at a climate meeting in Copenhagen have given a muted response to calls from the head of the United Nations for greater ambition when it comes to reducing countries’ greenhouse gas emissions

title: Drought in Spain's northeast empties reservoirs
description: The medieval church of Sant Romà disappeared from view in the 1960s, when the town of Vilanova de Sau was flooded to create a reservoir an hour north of Barcelona

title: German prosecutors examined late pope in abuse probe
description: German prosecutors looking into historical cases of sexual abuse by clergy in the Munich archdiocese say that they initially investigated the late Pope Benedict XVI on suspicion of being an accessory to abuse, but later dropped the probe

title: U.S. pushing Canada to lead planned Haiti force as Biden visits Ottawa
description: The Biden administration wants Ottawa to assume a "leadership role." Prime Minister Justin Trudeau says Washington needs to do "much more" on sanctions.

title: Journalist freed in Mali welcomed in France by Macron
description: French journalist Olivier Dubois has been welcomed home by President Emmanuel Macron, one day after he was released in Mali

title: Jehovah's Witnesses: Hamburg attack survivors out of danger
description: The Jehovah’s Witnesses say all of the survivors of the shooting at one of its halls in Hamburg this month are out of danger

title: Swedish court OKs activists to sue state over climate policy
description: A court in Sweden has allowed a group of environmental activists, including Greta Thunberg, to file a lawsuit against the Swedish state for what they say is insufficient action on the climate

title: Austrian museum skews paintings to reflect climate change
description: A Vienna museum is hanging some of its paintings at an angle to reflect the possible effects of climate change on the landscapes they depict

title: Ukraine, Russia trade claims after blast rocks Crimean town
description: Russian and Ukrainian officials on Tuesday gave conflicting accounts of what appeared to be a brazen attack late Monday on Russian cruise missiles being transported by train in Moscow-annexed Crimea

title: Yemeni rebels sentence activists to prison for criticism
description: ِA Yemeni lawyer says a court in the country’s rebel-held capital has sentenced four activists to prison terms, ranging from six months to three years, over their criticism of the rebels on social media

title: China portrays Xi’s Russia trip as bid for leadership of non-Western world
description: Chinese media was awash with coverage of the visit as evidence of China’s mettle when it comes to standing up to Washington and offering a model to the rest of the world.

title: France: Protests continue after Macron's pension plan push
description: Paris police say 234 people were arrested overnight in the capital mostly for setting fire to garbage in the streets

title: Japan’s leader in Kyiv to back Ukraine as China’s Xi visits Russia
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is in Kyiv to see Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky as China's Xi Jinping meets Russia's Vladimir Putin in Moscow.

title: With crowded jails, North Macedonia adopts pandemic amnesty
description: North Macedonia’s parliament has adopted a legislative amendment to pardon people facing imprisonment for violating COVID-19 safety rules

title: Cyprus court: Briton freely confessed to wife's killing
description: A Cyprus court has rejected a defense argument that a British man’s confession to killing his ailing wife was unlawfully obtained because he was in no frame of mind at the time to speak to police without a lawyer present

title: Saudi Arabia frees U.S. citizen imprisoned over tweets about crown prince
description: Saad Almadi, a 72-year-old living in Florida, was arrested in Riyadh in 2021 after posting tweets critical of Mohammed bin Salman's government.

title: Racism, misogyny rampant in London police force, ‘damning’ report finds
description: Louise Casey's report recommended that many specialized units be revetted or disbanded and said that if progress in reforms wasn't made, options should include breaking up the Met.

title: At Ukraine's front, police try to evacuate holdout families
description: For months, authorities have been urging civilians in areas near the fighting in eastern Ukraine to evacuate to safer parts of the country

title: Taiwan’s president to visit U.S., raising prospect of friction with China
description: Tsai Ing-wen will stop in New York and Los Angeles on her way to and from Central America, and is expected to meet House Speaker Kevin McCarthy during the trip.

title: Live updates: Xi and Putin to hold formal talks in Moscow
As G-20 meetings come to India, Modi launches a public relations blitz
description: The campaign seeks to hammer home a message that the prime minister is winning clout and respect for India internationally.

title: Japan, China leaders visit rival capitals in Ukraine war
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida began a surprise visit to Ukraine early Tuesday, hours after Chinese President Xi Jinping

title: Venezuela oil czar in surprise resignation amid graft probes
description: The man responsible for running Venezuela’s oil industry — the one that pays for virtually everything in the troubled country, from subsidized food to ridiculously cheap gas — has quit amid investigations into alleged corruption among public officials

title: Bullfighting ban faces critical legislative vote in Colombia
description: The tradition of bullfighting has taken some blows around the world recently with courts and municipal governments in cities like Barcelona, Medellin and Mexico City issuing rulings that have discouraged promoters from staging these events

title: Xi meets Putin in show of anti-West unity, but there’s unease, too
description: The Russian and Chinese presidents will tout their countries’ great friendship. But in reality, the Kremlin is turning into Beijing’s de facto vassal.
